pr_title: refactor(eureka): Move Eureka out of kork-core into kork-eureka

timeline.bodyText: I think there should be a spring.factories in here referencing this config, and I also think that PlatformComponents in kork-core needs to remove this from its Import but I don't see that change in here
timeline.author: cfieber

replies.bodyText: Ah, yarp. I did do that, but didn't push it.
replies.author: robzienert

timeline.bodyText:
I think it might be worth adding another autoconfiguration class here conditional on eureka.enabled=false that publishes a Status UP event (I know something similar exists in orca and others that try to control polling activity based on in-service status for the case where there is no discovery service):
https://github.com/spinnaker/orca/blob/master/orca-eureka/src/main/java/com/netflix/spinnaker/orca/eureka/NoDiscoveryApplicationStatusPublisher.java
timeline.author: cfieber

replies.bodyText: alternatively there could be an autoconfiguration in kork-core that supplies that ConditionalOnMissingBean, and this configuration could be flagged to AutoConfigureBefore that configuration so the conditional stuff actually works
replies.author: cfieber
